summary: Identified two root causes: (1) <C-\> is reserved in terminal mode and cannot be remapped - Neovim intercepts it for escape sequences; (2) TermOpen autocmd pattern timing means buffer isn't named yet when event fires. Recommended solutions: use <C-\><C-s> sequence, <M-\>, or <C-Space> instead.

artifacts.summary: Root cause analysis of why <C-\> mapping fails in Claude Code sidebar with 5 solution recommendations

next_steps: Run /plan 768 to create implementation plan for chosen solution

root_causes: <C-\> is reserved in Neovim terminal mode - intercepts before user mappings
TermOpen fires before buffer is renamed by claude-code.nvim plugin
metadata.recommended_solution: Use <C-\><C-s> sequence which follows terminal escape pattern
